summary.en: CLV most commonly means Customer Lifetime Value in business and marketing.
summary.zh: CLV最常见的意思是商业与营销中的“客户终身价值”。

definition.en: (abbrev.) Customer Lifetime Value: the total profit or revenue a business expects to earn from one customer over the entire relationship.
definition.zh: （缩写）客户终身价值：企业预计在与某位客户的整个关系周期内从该客户获得的总利润或总收入。

examples.en: Our CLV is rising because customers stay longer and buy more often.
examples.zh: 我们的CLV在上升，因为客户留存更久、购买更频繁。

examples.en: Marketing spend makes sense only if CLV is higher than the cost to acquire a customer.
examples.zh: 只有当CLV高于获客成本时，营销投入才算划算。

definition.en: (abbrev.) In some contexts, simply the spoken letters “C-L-V,” used as a label, code, or abbreviation in documents.
definition.zh: （缩写）在某些语境中就是读作字母“C-L-V”，用作标签、代码或文档缩略写法。

examples.en: Please write CLV on the form so we can match the record later.
examples.zh: 请在表格上写CLV，方便我们之后匹配记录。

extraExplanation: 在商业/营销里，CLV常与CAC（Customer Acquisition Cost，获客成本）一起看：常见思路是让CLV显著高于CAC。
计算CLV的方法很多：从简单的“平均客单价 × 购买频率 × 平均留存时间”，到更复杂的“折现后的未来现金流”模型。具体用哪种取决于行业和数据情况。
